007package renderer.pipeline;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import static renderer.pipeline.PipelineLogger.*;
012
013import java.awt.Color;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016
017/**
018   Clip in camera space any {@link Triangle} that that crosses
019   the camera's near clipping plane {@code z = -near}. Interpolate
020   {@link Vertex} color from any clipped off {@link Vertex} to
021   the new {@link Vertex}.
022*/
023public class NearClip_Triangle
024{
025   /**
026      If the {@link Triangle} crosses the camera's near plane,
027      then return a clipped version that is contained in the far
028      side of the near plane. When a triangle gets clipped, the
029      result can be either one or two new triangles.  The new
030      clipped {@link Triangle} objects are returned in a
031      {@link List} object.
032      <p>
033      Two new clipped {@link Vertex} objects may be added to the
034      {@link Model}'s vertex list and two new interpolated
035      {@link Color} objects may be added to the model's color list.
036      <p>
037      If the {@link Triangle} is completely on the camera side
038      of the near plane, then return an empty {@link List} object
039      to indicate that the {@link Triangle} should be discarded
040      from the model's {@link Primitive} list.
041
042      @param model   {@link Model} that the {@link Triangle} {@code tri} comes from
043      @param tri     {@link Triangle} to be clipped
044      @param camera  {@link Camera} that determines the near clipping plane
045      @return a clipped version of {@code tri} in a {@link List} object
046   */
047   public static List<Primitive> clip(final Model model,
048                                      final Triangle tri,
049                                      final Camera camera)
050   {
051      // Make local copies of several values.
052      final double n = camera.n;
053
054      final int index0 = tri.vIndexList.get(0);
055      final int index1 = tri.vIndexList.get(1);
056      final int index2 = tri.vIndexList.get(2);
057
058      final Vertex v0 = model.vertexList.get( index0 );
059      final Vertex v1 = model.vertexList.get( index1 );
060      final Vertex v2 = model.vertexList.get( index2 );
061
062      final double x0 = v0.x,  y0 = v0.y,  z0 = v0.z;
063      final double x1 = v1.x,  y1 = v1.y,  z1 = v1.z;
064      final double x2 = v2.x,  y2 = v2.y,  z2 = v2.z;
065
066      // 1. Check for trivial accept.
067    //if ( z0 <= n && z1 <= n && z2 <= n )
068      if ( n >= z0 && n >= z1 && n >= z2 )
069      {
070         if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Trivial accept.");
071         return java.util.Arrays.asList(tri);
072      }
073      // 2. Check for trivial delete.
074      else if ( z0 > n && z1 > n && z2 > n )
075      {
076         if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Trivial delete.");
077         return new ArrayList<Primitive>();
078      }
079      // 3. Need to clip this triangle.
080      else
081      {
082         if (z0 > n && z1 <= n && z2 <= n)
083         {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v0.
084            if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip off v0.");
085            return interpolateNewTriangles(model, tri, 0, 1, 2, n);
086         }
087         else if (z2 <= n && z0 > n && z1 > n)
088         {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v2 and new v0, v1.
089            if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip off v0 & v1.");
090            return interpolateNewTriangle(model, tri, 2, 0, 1, n);
091         }
092         else if (z1 > n && z0 <= n && z2 <= n)
093         {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v1.
094            if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip off v1.");
095            return interpolateNewTriangles(model, tri, 1, 2, 0, n);
096         }
097         else if (z0 <= n && z1 > n && z2 > n)
098         {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v0 and new v1, v2.
099            if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip off v1 & v2.");
100            return interpolateNewTriangle(model, tri, 0, 1, 2, n);
101         }
102         else if (z2 > n && z0 <= n && z1 <= n)
103         {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v2.
104            if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip off v2.");
105            return interpolateNewTriangles(model, tri, 2, 0, 1, n);
106         }
107         else // if (z1 <= n && z0 > n && z2 > n)
108         {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v1 and new v0, v2.
109            if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip off v0 & v2.");
110            return interpolateNewTriangle(model, tri, 1, 2, 0, n);
111         }
112      }
113   }
114
115
116   /**
117      This method takes three indices for three vertices, one that is on
118      the "right" side of the near plane and the other two that are on the
119      "wrong" side of the near plane.
120      <p>
121      The three vertices should be given in a counterclockwise ordering around the triangle.
122      <p>
123      This method returns a clipped {@link Triangle} with the index index0_keep
124      and the indices for two new interpolated vertices, both of which have been
125      put into the {@link Model}'s vertex list. Two new {@link Color} objects will
126      also have been added to the {@link Model}'s color list.
127
128      @param model        {@link Model} object that holds the {@link Vertex} {@link List}
129      @param tri          the {@link Triangle} being clipped
130      @param index0_keep  the index in {@code tri} of the {@link Vertex} that is being kept
131      @param index1_clip  the index in {@code tri} of a {@link Vertex} that needs to be clipped off
132      @param index2_clip  the index in {@code tri} of a {@link Vertex} that needs to be clipped off
133      @param n            the location of the near clipping plane, z = n
134      @return {@link List} containing a new clipped {@link Triangle} object
135   */
136   private static List<Primitive> interpolateNewTriangle(
137                                       final Model model,
138                                       final Triangle tri,
139                                       final int index0_keep,
140                                       final int index1_clip,
141                                       final int index2_clip,
142                                       final double n)
143   {
144      if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Create one new triangle.\n");
145
146      // Interpolate a new vertex between index0_keep and index1_clip.
147      // The new vertex, color, and texture objects are at the end of
148      // the model's vertex, color, and texture lists.
149      interpolateNewVertex(model,
150                           tri,
151                           index0_keep,
152                           index1_clip,
153                           n);
154
155      // Interpolate a new vertex between index0_keep and index2_clip.
156      // The new vertex, color, and texture objects are at the end of
157      // the model's vertex, color, and texture lists.
158      interpolateNewVertex(model,
159                           tri,
160                           index0_keep,
161                           index2_clip,
162                           n);
163
164      // Create a new Triangle primitive using the new vertex.
165      // Make sure it has the same orientation as the original triangle.
166      // (We cannot reuse the original Triangle object since we don't
167      //  know which vertex is in which location of the triangle.)
168      final int vIndex1_new = model.vertexList.size() - 2;
169      final int cIndex1_new = model.colorList.size() - 2;
170      final int vIndex2_new = model.vertexList.size() - 1;
171      final int cIndex2_new = model.colorList.size() - 1;
172
173      final Triangle tri_new;
174      if (! tri.textured)
175      {
176         tri_new = new Triangle(tri.vIndexList.get(index0_keep),
177                                vIndex1_new,
178                                vIndex2_new,
179                                tri.cIndexList.get(index0_keep),
180                                cIndex1_new,
181                                cIndex2_new);
182      }
183      else // a textured Triangle
184      {
185         final int tcIndex1_new = model.texCoordList.size() - 2;
186         final int tcIndex2_new = model.texCoordList.size() - 1;
187         tri_new = new Triangle(tri.vIndexList.get(index0_keep),
188                                vIndex1_new,
189                                vIndex2_new,
190                                tri.cIndexList.get(index0_keep),
191                                cIndex1_new,
192                                cIndex2_new,
193                                tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
194                                tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
195                                tri.cIndexList2.get(2),
196                                tri.tcIndexList.get(index0_keep),
197                                tcIndex1_new,
198                                tcIndex2_new,
199                                tri.textureIndex);
200      }
201
202      //if (Clip.debug) logMessage( tri_new.toString() );
203      return java.util.Arrays.asList(tri_new);
204   }//interpolateNewTriangle()
205
206
207   /**
208      This method takes three indices for three vertices, two that are on
209      the "right" side of the near plane and one that is on the "wrong"
210      side of the near plane.
211      <p>
212      The three vertices should be given in a counterclockwise ordering around the triangle.
213      <p>
214      This method returns two new {@link Triangle} objects, one from the
215      two inside vertices to a new interpolated vertex, and the other new
216      triangle from the two new interpolated vertices to one of the original
217      inside vertices. Two new {@link Vertex} objects and two new {@link Color}
218      objects will have also been added to the {@link Model}'s vertex and color
219      lists.
220
221      @param model        {@link Model} object that holds the {@link Vertex} {@link List}
222      @param tri          the {@link Triangle} being clipped
223      @param index0_clip  the index in {@code tri} of the {@link Vertex} that needs to be clipped off
224      @param index1_keep  the index in {@code tri} of a {@link Vertex} that is inside the view rectangle
225      @param index2_keep  the index in {@code tri} of a {@link Vertex} that is inside the view rectangle
226      @param n      the location of the near clipping plane, z = n
227      @return {@link List} containing two new clipped {@link Triangle} objects
228   */
229   private static List<Primitive> interpolateNewTriangles(
230                                       final Model model,
231                                       final Triangle tri,
232                                       final int index0_clip,
233                                       final int index1_keep,
234                                       final int index2_keep,
235                                       final double n)
236   {
237      if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Create two new triangles.\n");
238
239      // Interpolate a new vertex between v1_keep and v0_clip.
240      // The new vertex, color, and texture coordinate objects are at the
241      // end of the model's vertex, color, and texture coordinate lists.
242      interpolateNewVertex(model,
243                           tri,
244                           index1_keep,
245                           index0_clip,
246                           n);
247
248      // Interpolate a new vertex between v2_keep and v0_clip.
249      // The new vertex, color, and texture coordinate objects are at the
250      // end of the model's vertex, color, and texture coordinate lists.
251      interpolateNewVertex(model,
252                           tri,
253                           index2_keep,
254                           index0_clip,
255                           n);
256
257      final int vIndex0_new1 = model.vertexList.size() - 2;
258      final int cIndex0_new1 = model.colorList.size() - 2;
259      final int vIndex0_new2 = model.vertexList.size() - 1;
260      final int cIndex0_new2 = model.colorList.size() - 1;
261
262      // Create a new Triangle primitive using the first new vertex.
263      // Make sure it has the same orientation as the original triangle.
264      // (We cannot reuse the original Triangle object since we don't
265      //  know which vertex is in which location of the triangle.)
266      final Triangle tri_1;
267      if (! tri.textured)
268      {
269         tri_1 = new Triangle(vIndex0_new1,
270                             tri.vIndexList.get(index1_keep),
271                             tri.vIndexList.get(index2_keep),
272                             cIndex0_new1,
273                             tri.cIndexList.get(index1_keep),
274                             tri.cIndexList.get(index2_keep));
275      }
276      else // a textured Triangle
277      {
278         final int tcIndex0_new1 = model.texCoordList.size() - 2;
279         tri_1 = new Triangle(vIndex0_new1,
280                              tri.vIndexList.get(index1_keep),
281                              tri.vIndexList.get(index2_keep),
282                              cIndex0_new1,
283                              tri.cIndexList.get(index1_keep),
284                              tri.cIndexList.get(index2_keep),
285                              tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
286                              tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
287                              tri.cIndexList2.get(2),
288                              tcIndex0_new1,
289                              tri.tcIndexList.get(index1_keep),
290                              tri.tcIndexList.get(index2_keep),
291                              tri.textureIndex);
292      }
293
294      // Create a new Triangle primitive using the two new vertices.
295      // Make sure it has the same orientation as the original triangle.
296      final Triangle tri_2;
297      if (! tri.textured)
298      {
299         tri_2 = new Triangle(vIndex0_new2,
300                              vIndex0_new1,
301                              tri.vIndexList.get(index2_keep),
302                              cIndex0_new2,
303                              cIndex0_new1,
304                              tri.cIndexList.get(index2_keep));
305      }
306      else // a textured Triangle
307      {
308         final int tcIndex0_new1 = model.texCoordList.size() - 2;
309         final int tcIndex0_new2 = model.texCoordList.size() - 1;
310         tri_2 = new Triangle(vIndex0_new2,
311                              vIndex0_new1,
312                              tri.vIndexList.get(index2_keep),
313                              cIndex0_new2,
314                              cIndex0_new1,
315                              tri.cIndexList.get(index2_keep),
316                              tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
317                              tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
318                              tri.cIndexList2.get(2),
319                              tcIndex0_new2,
320                              tcIndex0_new1,
321                              tri.tcIndexList.get(index2_keep),
322                              tri.textureIndex);
323      }
324
325      //if (Clip.debug) logMessage( tri_1.toString() );
326      //if (Clip.debug) logMessage( tri_2.toString() );
327      return java.util.Arrays.asList(tri_1, tri_2);
328   }//interpolateNewTriangles()
329
330
331   /**
332      This method takes in two vertices, one that is on the "right" side
333      of the near plane and the other that is on the "wrong" side of the
334      near plane. This method adds to the {@link Model}'s vertex list the
335      vertex that is the intersection point between the given line segment
336      and the near plane.
337      <p>
338      This method solves for the value of {@code t} for which the
339      parametric equation
340      <pre>{@code
341                  p(t) = (1-t) * v_clip + t * v_keep
342      }</pre>
343      intersects the near plane. (Notice that the equation is parameterized
344      so that we move from the clipped vertex towards the kept vertex as
345      {@code t} increases from 0 to 1.) The solved for value of {@code t}
346      is then plugged into the parametric formula to get the coordinates
347      of the intersection point. The solved for value of {@code t} is also
348      used to interpolate a new {@link Color} object for the new vertex,
349      and the new {@link Color} object is added to the end of the
350      {@link Model}'s color list.
351
352      @param model  {@link Model} object that holds the vertex list
353      @param tri    the {@link Triangle} being clipped
354      @param keep   the index in {@code tri} of the {@link Vertex} that is being kept
355      @param clip   the index in {@code tri} of the {@link Vertex} that is being clipped
356      @param n      the location of the near clipping plane, z = n
357   */
358   private static void interpolateNewVertex(final Model model,
359                                            final Triangle tri,
360                                            final int keep,
361                                            final int clip,
362                                            final double n)
363   {
364      if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Create new vertex.");
365
366      // Make local copies of several values.
367      final Vertex v_keep = model.vertexList.get( tri.vIndexList.get(keep) );
368      final Vertex v_clip = model.vertexList.get( tri.vIndexList.get(clip) );
369      final Color  c_keep = model.colorList.get(  tri.cIndexList.get(keep) );
370      final Color  c_clip = model.colorList.get(  tri.cIndexList.get(clip) );
371
372      final double vKx = v_keep.x;  // "K" for "keep"
373      final double vKy = v_keep.y;
374      final double vKz = v_keep.z;
375      final float cK[] = c_keep.getRGBColorComponents(null);
376      final double vCx = v_clip.x;  // "C" for "clip"
377      final double vCy = v_clip.y;
378      final double vCz = v_clip.z;
379      final float cC[] = c_clip.getRGBColorComponents(null);
380
381      // Interpolate between v_clip and v_keep.
382      final double t = (n - vCz) / (vKz - vCz); // clip to z = n
383
384      // Use the value of t to interpolate the coordinates of the new vertex.
385    //final double x = (1-t) * vCx + t * vKx;
386    //final double y = (1-t) * vCy + t * vKy;
387      final double x = vCx + t * (vKx - vCx);
388      final double y = vCy + t * (vKy - vCy);
389      final double z = n;
390
391      final Vertex v_new = new Vertex(x, y, z);
392
393      // Use the value of t to interpolate the color of the new vertex.
394      final float t_ = (float)t;
395    //final float r = (1-t_) * cC[0] + t_ * cK[0];
396    //final float g = (1-t_) * cC[1] + t_ * cK[1];
397    //final float b = (1-t_) * cC[2] + t_ * cK[2];
398      final float r = cC[0] + t_ * (cK[0] - cC[0]);
399      final float g = cC[1] + t_ * (cK[1] - cC[1]);
400      final float b = cC[2] + t_ * (cK[2] - cC[2]);
401
402      final Color c_new = new Color(r, g, b);
403
404      // Modify the Model to contain the new Vertex and Color.
405      model.vertexList.add(v_new);
406      model.colorList.add(c_new);
407
408      // Use the value of t to interpolate the texture coordinates of the new vertex.
409      if (tri.textured)
410      {
411         final TexCoord tc_keep = model.texCoordList.get( tri.tcIndexList.get(keep) );
412         final TexCoord tc_clip = model.texCoordList.get( tri.tcIndexList.get(clip) );
413
414       //final double sTex = (1-t) * tc_clip.s + t * tc_keep.s;
415       //final double tTex = (1-t) * tc_clip.t + t * tc_keep.t;
416         final double sTex = tc_clip.s + t * (tc_keep.s - tc_clip.s);
417         final double tTex = tc_clip.t + t * (tc_keep.t - tc_clip.t);
418         // Modify the Model to contain the new TexCoord.
419         model.texCoordList.add(new TexCoord(sTex, tTex));
420      }
421
422
423      if (Clip.debug)
424      {
425         logMessage(String.format("-- t = % .25f", t));
426         logMessage(String.format("-- <x_C,y_C> = <% .24f % .24f", vCx, vCy));
427         logMessage(String.format("-- <x_K,y_K> = <% .24f % .24f", vKx, vKy));
428         logMessage(String.format("-- <x,  y>   = <% .24f % .24f",   x,   y));
429         logMessage(String.format("-- <r_C,g_C,b_C> = <% .15f  % .15f  % .15f>",
430                                       cC[0], cC[1], cC[2]));
431         logMessage(String.format("-- <r_K,g_K,b_K> = <% .15f  % .15f  % .15f>",
432                                       cK[0], cK[1], cK[2]));
433         logMessage(String.format("-- <r,  g,  b>   = <% .15f  % .15f  % .15f>",
434                                       r,  g,  b));
435      }
436   }
437
438
439
440   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
441   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
442   private NearClip_Triangle() {
443      throw new AssertionError();
444   }
445}
